WHAT WE DO

Types of photography and services that we are happy to offer you

Portrait Photography

Headshots Photography, Street Portrait Photography, Fine Art Photography, Street Fashion Photography, Boudoir Photography, Studio/Indoor Portraits, Business Photography

Portfolio

We can build your portfolio from beginning or we can create for you very fresh and unique photographs to update your existing portfolio

Magazine Photoshoots

Portrait Photography & Editorials for magazines and individual Photo Models

Social Media Feed Plans (to give you constant and regular photography content for your FB & IG )

Four Seasons Photoshoot Plan ( Spring, Summer, Autumn & Winter Photoshoots)

All Year Photoshoots Plan (12 photoshoots during the year, one photoshoot per month)

Photoshoot Trips ( with us as your own Photographer, MUA & Stylist Team ):

In the UK ( In the most popular cities like London, Manchester, Liverpool, Birmingham,Edinburgh etc.)

In Europe ( Paris, Amsterdam, Barcelona, Madrid, Warsaw, Berlin, Bruselss etc. )

Business Photoshoots

Business Portraits Photoshoots ( in the Photography Studio,your workplace or other business locations )

Modeling:

Photo modeling with product presentation for boutiques, shops and individuals from clothing and fashion industry

About Us

Learn more about us.

Tomasz Lekawa

Internationally published Photographer, Editor

Alicja Lekawa

Internationally published freelance Photomodel, Makeup Artist & Stylist

ATL Photography Ltd was created in 2021 by us, Alicja & Tomasz Lekawa. Our passion is to photograph people, create unique portraits and professional portfolios.Our work has been published in over 50 fashion, modeling and lifestyle magazines around the World. This includes our editorials published on the covers of magazines in New York, Paris and many more.

For more information about us, our work and publications, please visit our Portfolio website.

Portfolio

For more information about us and our work, please visit our personal portfolio website.

OUTDOOR SESSION

This is the first item's accordion body. It is shown by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It's also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the though the transition does limit overflow.
